snippet: If the Orion test flight succeeds Thursday, it will be the first time since Apollo 17 in 1972 that NASA has launched an astronaut capsule to soar beyond low Earth orbit.
abstract: NASA is poised to launch an astronaut capsule beyond Earth's orbit for first time since Apollo 17 returned from the moon in 1972; Orion capsule will be unmanned, but marks first step toward NASA's goal of human exploration in solar system, with first manned mission slated for 2020s.
lead_paragraph: If the Orion test flight succeeds Thursday, it will be the first time since Apollo 17 in 1972 that NASA has launched an astronaut capsule to soar beyond low Earth orbit.

headline.main: NASA Sees Capsule Test as a Step Toward Mars
headline.print_headline: NASA Sees Capsule Test as a Step Toward Mars
